Been playing this game for two years now, and I love it to pieces. Yes, it has a large margin of errors and improvements to be made, but the devs clearly care so much, and being a part of streaming communities, making friends and having a blast playing are all invaluable experiences Dead by Daylight has given me. It's changed my life, for better and for worse.

[Previously I said] I love this game and I love that the Devs work so hard on making it better over time. The fact that I can play on both sides of the game, killer AND survivor, gives me a chance to change it up some.  My ONLY complaint about the game is there is no block function  and I've had to deal with abusive toxic players in game and in chat afterwards, with little to nothing done about their behavior in the game.  A block function would do wonders for this community and for this game.
[Now I say] I would love to play this game more often but the devs care nothing about the cheating that goes on. They refuse to acknowledge that their hit box is not really a hitbox but a guesstimate (other games have no problem knowing what a hit box is.. when I get shot in red dead, I hold my arm if it hit my arm.. just for example) The Devs fave killers are called broken by most of the community but they refuse to fix them. So when a hatchet is thrown and goes through a solid object.. that's just 'latency'. You get hit after clearly getting away... again.. latency is blamed. A streamer on twitch streams extreme cheating for days ... gets reported TONS and still keeps cheating. We report extreme stalking and harassing to them and they refuse to give us a BLOCK function because (In bhvr Peanits words, on his live stream, "You are just trying to make the game easier for yourself because you would block people that beat you." ) How about we'd LOVE to block the people that spent 4 weeks stalking you, harassing your family and friends, stream sniping you so they could harass you in game and in chat after on SEVERAL occasions.  I love this game as an idea.. I do not love what they allow and/or won't fix.
Best game I've ever played but the most bugged game ever played too
Super viel Spa√ü mit Freunden. Zwar kompliziert an manchen stellen trotzdem sehr gut
